article.headline: N. Carolina A&amp,T 82, UNC-Greensboro 70
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Thomas Coleman scored 20 points and grabbed 14 rebounds to lead North Carolina A&T on a second-half surge to beat North Carolina-Greensboro 82-70 on Monday night. North Carolina A&T trailed 66-63 with 6:33 left on the clock, but the Aggies outscored the Spartans 19-4 the rest of the way to prevent Greensboro (0-5) from earning its first victory of the season. The Aggies (4-3) shot 14 for 27 from the floor (51.9 percent) in the first half but still trailed 43-40 at the break. The Spartans shot 18 of 37 from the field (48.6 percent) in the first half, but a 9-for-34 shooting effort (26.5 percent) in the second proved to be their undoing. Kyle Randall scored a game-high 23 points and Aloysius Henry added 12 points and 15 rebounds in the loss for Greensboro. Randall failed to score a point over the final 13:26 as the Aggies mounted their comeback.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
